Stayed with a pet
review_text: For the most part it is very nice and clean with lots of room. Only a few things that I see, that could improve things. The new loft still had styrofoam/ plastic left in the new oven in the kitchen. So it much just got put in a few days ago. The kitchen is beautiful, but there was no appliances, skillets, no plates or anything to make food for our family ? Just a few glasses and forks, knives & spoons. There was someones McDonald's food that was Left in the bottom of the freezer of the refrigerator too ? Bathroom was very nice and a huge walk-in shower! Just beautiful! Also the living room area which is huge only has a medium size sofa when no other chairs or recliners in it ? So when my Son & his girlfriend visited to watch some Television, we all had to sit together tightly on the couch, so it wasn't particularly comfortable? The Grandmother that was there when we arrived only Saturday morning was so very nice and helpful! A charming woman! This is the quietist Air B & B ever.

review_text: First, I want to say it was a beautiful little studio, and it was kept clean but being questioned about my service dogs and being told that one of my dogs is â€œunableâ€ to be a service animal ruined the entire experience. As soon as I got down from my car with my pregnant wife and son, after a 12 hour drive, I was immediately met with rude comments about my 2 service dogs (An Australian Shepard & a Pug). As a disabled veteran I need both my pups with me at all times. I was so exhausted from that drive and honestly confused at what she was saying but telling me which dogs are allowed to be service animals was extremely rude and slightly offensive. My dogs are both extremely intelligent, trained and make no noise. Per Airbnb policy she was only allowed to ask what service they provide, but discrediting one of my dogs status as a service animal due to their breed was enough to make my wife and I uncomfortable.

review_text:
Linda was wonderful, we booked her place with only a few days before we left as we were heading out for spring break - with a winter storm chasing us; and suddenly needed to start our journey sooner than planned!
We requested a late check in - which Linda said was no problem, and checked what ages of children she allowed. Linda quickly responded with answers to all the questions we had. On the evening we were meant to arrive, there was a mud slide near Vail which shut the I70 down and made us even later! Linda was soo kind and flexible - nothing phased her! She graciously sent me some great instructions and details about the casita and we found it no problem. It was easy to access - even though it was late and dark, was lovely and clean as well as artistically decorated. We only spent the night and left early the next morning, but it was a just what we needed ! We will certainly be back again and plan on spending some more time exploring the backyard! Thank you Linda !!

Stayed one night
review_text:
This backyard loft is cozy and well prepared. Pamela was prompt in sending check-in/entry instructions. The loft was clean, smelled lovely, had multiple beds, a great bathroom with a large shower to accompany the 2 person jacuzzi bathtub. In addition, the loft had just about everything you could need for commodities and amenities: hygiene products. Coffee, shampoo, conditioner, tea, etc.
Overall I thought this location was well worth the asking price, exceeding the quality of most local hotels and offering a balcony as well. The only minor downside was that the balcony is in the backyard and overlooks a bit of well used space by the owner's family, the view mostly being tools, work in progress, etc. But this was not a drawback for me at all, the interior is wonderful and I am happy to write this review encouraging others to give this spot a try if you're visiting GJ or need a staycation. Located close to downtown to enjoy the bar scene when the warmer weather is in swing.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The suite is very comfortable and private and well stocked with everything you need for a stay in case you forget something at home - shampoo's, lotions, variety of foaming bath liquid for the large tub. The tea cart/light kitchen is as advertised - small fridge for leftovers, snacks and a few drinks, nice selection of coffee and tea, Keurig, toaster, microwave. It is not set up for cooking meals - which the Host specifically says in the property description. I'm repeating that in my review, because I missed that when we booked. It was not an issue because we were there for a long weekend and the set up is plenty for a light breakfast of yogurt/fruit/toast or to make a sandwich for a hike. The host graciously has a tub for dirty dishes and takes them to be washed. We enjoyed the short walk to the many downtown restaurants. We recommend making reservations before you arrive for your first night's dinner. It's in a quiet neighborhood and has many personal touches to make it feel comfortable.

name: Catherine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2021
,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
Pamela and John were absolutely amazing hosts, who went above and beyond with every aspect of hosting!! We very much enjoyed our 19-day stay at their lovely, relaxing and extremely well-stocked place, thanks to their incredible kindness, generosity and unparalleled hospitality.
Pamela and John were so friendly and considerate, checking in via messages to see if we needed anything, and so nice to chat with in person whenever our paths crossed. They generously gave us welcome gifts of chocolates, plus special "reverse osmosis" filtered water and even gave us fresh zucchini muffins before we left! They provided so many wonderful, practical and thoughtful extras throughout the house, with the kitchenette including a jar of delicious biscotti, a large variety of coffee K cups and herbal teas, creamers, bottled water, instant oats and popcorn in the kitchen. There were even more fantastic extras in the bathroom, with a range of at least six bath salts available for the jacuzzi -- the star of the bathroom, complete with mood lighting! -- and a big selection of body washes, shampoos, conditioners, lotions, moisturizers and a wide range of useful toiletries.
The suite was very clean, spacious, airy and light; well designed with a circular layout; and charmingly furnished with Japanese themed decorations, plus pretty lights, quaint knick-knacks and colorful paintings and prints. It was very conveniently located, close to Main Street and all its shops and restaurants.
The kitchenette was compact but well stocked and very easy to use, with coffee maker, mini fridge, microwave, toaster, knife set and a full range of plates, bowls, mugs, cups, glasses, paper cups and plastic utensils. Pamela and John were so kind as to provide a container for dirty dishes, which they offered to wash if needed, and supply refills of "reverse osmosis" filtered water.
There were several bedding options, with a comfy queen bed, big day bed and a small child sized bed available. We enjoyed relaxing on the sofa, which could recline and had foldout foot rests, to watch TV (Samsung with Netflix and other streaming services).
The swamp cooler system and ceiling fan efficiently kept the suite cool during hot days, and the wifi was good, allowing us easily to work remotely, and strong especially near the small table in the living room.
It was very handy to have a washer and a dryer, both of which worked well, and a storage area that could be used for luggage or bikes.
The deck was a great place to sit and relax outside, with comfy seating, an umbrella providing shade and a grill.
We really appreciated that Pamela and John allowed us to use their driveway during our stay, parking their own cars off the sidewalk, just another sign of their generosity. We're so glad to have been able to stay at their unique, special and peaceful place. We would love to stay again if in the area and are so grateful to Pamela and John for every single wonderful thing they did to make our stay so fantastic!

Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: What a nice respite this beautiful cottage was for us! Our 'new' house in GJ was a mess of noise and dust, and we had to get away from it. We love old houses, but also a modern aesthetic and amenities and Sienna's place had it all. The vintage sense of the house was retained, but everything modernized. Gorgeous black kitchen was a pleasure to cook in. Creaky wood floors may bother some, but not us; we enjoyed them. Decor was MidMod and overall comfortable. Beds were so comfy and soft yet just firm enough for our 'old' backs. We needed a couple more towels and they responded almost instantly and dropped them off. The outside lighting and top-down shades in the living room were appreciated for safety and privacy. Black black-out shades in the bedrooms helped hugely for a daytime napper like me. Our dog loved the backyard and sniffing around all the landscaping to explore, and exercise. Bathroom functioned well. A great value also and we'll be back if we need a home-away-from-home again.

,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: This was a very nice/comfortable place to stay. The backyard was great for our dog to get some time off-leash. The location is fabulous for walking all around downtown and visiting the cool restaurants and shops. We luckily happened to be there during the annual Christmas float parade and it was so much fun to take the 5 min. walk down to the main street and see all the unique Christmas floats. What I really liked about the place was how it was heated. Normally I dread going into cold climates in the winter because the heaters dry out my skin so badly. This place had some very cool old-fashioned heaters that produced a nice warmth in the whole house without the dry air that the usual heaters produce. That was a very nice plus.

Stayed with kids
review_text: I have stayed at a lot of Airbnbs, but this one was truly the best. I have been to expensive places, places with pools, and places with great views, but this one was something special. The host's kindness stood out, the interior design was beautiful, and the sauna was fantastic! Also, being able to feed the horses nearby was a highlight, especially for our 2-year-old who loves animals. The open view was incredible, and two adult men slept comfortably on the two sofa beds without any complaints. There were not many blackout drapes and there were a lot of windows, so the sunlight came in early and woke the men up, which meant I did not have to wake them up myself. This was the best Airbnb during our trip. The welcome gift was also amazing! We will definitely come back.

review_text: Keith and Marnie's place is wonderful! My small family of 3 spent Thanksgiving there. The weather didn't cooperate with our plans to mountain bike (although we did get some biking in on Thanksgiving morning - I highly recommend Fruita for some awesome trails!!). But despite the cold, snowy weather, there was plenty to do inside with games, streaming, the dry sauna, and venturing outside to pet Roxy and Roscoe (the best horses ever!). We also did a day trip to Moab for some shopping and sightseeing. The house itself is cozy and inviting. The kitchen is well equipped and the farm fresh eggs, mandarins and local IPA were a special touch. Marnie was wonderful when we arrived, showing us around and introducing us to the animals. She made us feel right at home. Such a warm and welcoming home and host. Thank you for a wonderful stay, and we will come back when it's warmer to truly enjoy the trails.

review_text: Run, don't walk, to schedule your reservation at this perfect little gem. The location is just as described, and although you are on a shared property (with what I imagine is the owner) you have total seclusion and privacy the whole time. The renovation on this barn is modern, thoughtful, and perfectly clean. Plus, at every turn you encounter tiny little touches like a kitchen with extra appliances/condiments/treats, a bathroom with dispensers for all the self care products you would need. Access and directions were easy and clear. The barrel sauna was such a wonderful way to start the day on our way out of town. One of the cooler places we've stayed at, this property really encapsulates what can be so unique and wonderful about Air B&Bs when done right.

name: Stetson & Megan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: I would be shocked if this place ever gets less than 5 stars. As a fellow host, I was impressed and motivated to make our place better after staying here. The place is perfect. It feels new and modern while also feeling warm and homey at the same time. Our family of four (two small kids) had no problem sharing the space (we brought a blow up mattress for our kids but they would've been fine in the main living area) and we regretted that we were only there for one night. There was something for everyone here. From the private space to the animals to the amazing scenery, we were all blown away. The outdoor shower and sauna were lovely perks and the place just kept giving more surprises, like feeding the horses, hammocks, fresh eggs from the chickens, and a fire pit. The bed was comfortable, kitchen fully stocked, fireplace functional, and tons of natural light. On top of that, Marnie was quick to respond to messages and a joy to communicate with. We would love to come back.

From the farm fresh eggs and local craft beer in the fridge, to the floor to ceiling windows overlooking the sweeping valley views and enchanting sunflowers, my husband and I were completely transported and immersed in relaxation. And don't get me started on the epic and awe-inspiring nighttime views of the stars. You can't put a price tag on something like that. There are too many wonderful details to share, but we would highly recommend this gorgeous home to anyone looking for a prefect getaway. Thank you again for a fantastic stay!

review_text:
Family of 6 visiting over 4th of July - what a great location! Central to most everything, walkable to old Main, restaurants, etc. Everything was as advertised - including the bikes and hot tub. Kevin and his co-host sent recommendations that were very helpful, they were both quick to respond to messages. Twin beds are in the basement which worked out great having 2 teenagers with us that could have their own bathroom and space away.
We had an issue with the AC for 1 day where the house was hot overnight. Kevin had a repair man out the same night and again the next day to resolve the issue - even on the holiday. We recognize this wasnâ€™t anyoneâ€™s fault - just unfortunate timing.
Our only complaints are minor - no coffee/tea supplied so bring your own, and no curtains in the bedrooms - with sunset being at 9:30pm and sunrise before 6am, our kids had a hard time getting to sleep and then woke up super early. That may be personal preference - we prefer curtains to block the light.

review_text: Beautifully renovated home with unique touches. We found the photos of the home before the updates and were in love with the parts of the house the owners kept. The floor plan was ideal for us. Two large bedrooms on the main floor opposite of each other (great for privacy/noise as we had an infant) and a large bedroom in the basement that had plenty of space and light. The bathrooms was nicely done with plenty of natural light. We also made use of the laundry room. The kitchen was perfectly stocked with spices and cooking items. This home was ideal for the 6 of us traveling into town for a wedding. The backyard/hot tub was fantastic for us to relax in the evening and host a little bonfire. There was a great coffee shop (mountain air roasters) just down the road that we walked to on the nice cool mornings. Definitely one of the best Airbnbs that weâ€™ve had the pleasure of staying at. Highly recommend.

review_text: The Tie Dye Studio is a very nice, comfortable spot to spend some time in Grand Junction. There are a lot of fun, artsy, and thoughtful touches in the unit and it felt very private. Check-in/access is very easy; the host messages you the instructions well in advance and it works seamlessly. There are numerous lighting options, from dimmable overhead lights to reading lamps, and that is always appreciated. The most notable nearby attraction is the Colorado National Monument which is only about 20 minutes away, and I highly recommend it. Great spot and would definitely stay there again!

Â·

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: A key reason I chose this place, in addition to it being highly rated, was the grassy inviting setting in airbnb photo. While I usually stay with friends when I visit Grand Junction, I had a quick one night trip I needed to make. I wanted to host friends instead of them hosting me... and have wine and snacks on the grassy ssetting In reality, there was no grass, the setting was rocks, and it was hot. In response, Lalita said they had had problems with the grass so instead had the yard 'professionally xeriscaped'. Well, there was alot of rock.There were no plants which i thought xeriscaped might include some drought tolerant plants. I also couldnt get in the door, i put in last 4 of my phone number and while I heard the 'whir' of the lock, the bolt which I could see between the doors, did not move. I tried a few times, waiting in between for the mechanism to reset ( I contacted Lalita she said push on the door) I left to visit friends.) Came back couple hours later and lock worked.

Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: Lalita has completely clean, neat property, and is a great host. The cost to value is good! The neighborhood is alot of manufactured homes and converted RV's, but yards are cared for and clean; it felt very safe to us, and was also quiet! A lot of birds cooing in the back yard. The unit itself - while it has the basics (thank you!), the layout is not utilitarian - there is a converted closet that harbors kitchen counter, hot plate, some kitchen cabinets that have your necessary utensils, etc.; for coffee snobs, there is coffee, but its Folgers packets. But the kitchen microwave, toaster oven and large sink shared with large washer/dryer is accessed through the bathroom containing a toilet and shower. The large sink must be shared as a bathroom sink. Akward, but we appreciated the other elements and that it is completely private from the main unit. The drive way was not available, sluffed from the street through the gate. Foam bed. Even so, we enjoyed and appreciated our stay.

review_text:
We stopped here on our way back home from a Utah road trip. This is a good value and close access to the freeway.
There was a patio with table and chairs to sit outside, and is 420 friendly. The room was very clean and directions plus access was super easy. The space was colorful, open and airy. Bed was comfortable, and the heating was nice and cozy. It was perfect for the quick overnight stay. The kitchen set up had a toaster, fridge and nice big counter space, but the sink was in a separate location, so kind of funky and a little more difficult if you actually wanted to create meals while staying here. The laundry room (where the sink was) did not have the washer and dryer available for guests; that was unfortunate as we would have liked to wash some of our things. I would choose this nice space over a motel in town and that was our mindset. Thank you for the nice, convenient stay.

The bed was super comfy!!! We slept amazing each night. The space is cute and small but has everything you need! The Rocku TV was nice to keep us entertained at night(:
Clean space, plenty of room to get ready, eat food, and relax. the outdoor table was a must to be outside and enjoy fresh air (and smoke!)
We didnâ€™t cook as there wasnâ€™t a regular stove just the cook top inductor but the microwave was great for our meal choices and snacks. Some cooking spray or condiments wouldâ€™ve been nice to keep in the kitchen for guests though for guests who did wanna cook and feel at home(:
Overall a great space, good price, private, close to downtown Grand Junction (which we recommend for food options) and Palisade (have to try local Peach Salsa)!
What a great weekend. Thanks for being a part of it & hosting us! Would recommend to anyone in the area.

We met the guest staying in the front house and ended up purchasing the same book that she recommended- Roadside Geology of Colorado.
